items.label: Introduction to Dollar Cost Averaging with Vincent

dca-tutorial/agent.title: Creating Your DCA Agent
dca-tutorial/agent.description: In this section, we'll implement the core functionality of our Dollar Cost Averaging agent. We'll start by setting up the configuration and basic agent structure.

dca-tutorial/congratulations.title: Congratulations!
dca-tutorial/congratulations.description: You have successfully completed the Dollar Cost Averaging with Vincent tutorial! ðŸŽ‰

dca-tutorial/dca-logic.title: Implementing DCA Logic
dca-tutorial/dca-logic.description: In this section, we'll implement the core Dollar Cost Averaging logic that will handle the token purchases. This is where we'll define how our agent interacts with decentralized exchanges to execute trades.

dca-tutorial/deployment.title: Deploying Your DCA Agent
dca-tutorial/deployment.description: In this final section, we'll cover how to deploy your Dollar Cost Averaging agent to production. We'll discuss different deployment options, security considerations, and best practices for running your agent reliably.

dca-tutorial/introduction.title: Introduction to Dollar Cost Averaging with Vincent

dca-tutorial/setup.title: Setting Up Your Environment
dca-tutorial/setup.description: Before we can build our Dollar Cost Averaging agent, we need to set up our development environment with the necessary tools and dependencies.

dca-tutorial/testing.title: Testing Your DCA Agent
dca-tutorial/testing.description: In this section, we'll test our Dollar Cost Averaging agent to ensure it works correctly before deploying it to production. We'll focus on testing the core functionality on a testnet to avoid using real funds during development.

dca-tutorial/vincent-integration.title: Securing with Vincent
dca-tutorial/vincent-integration.description: In this section, we'll integrate Vincent's secure agent wallet system to ensure our DCA agent has the appropriate permissions to execute trades on behalf of the user. Vincent provides a secure, permission-based approach that gives users full control over what actions the agent can perform.

typescript-elizaos.title: @elizaos/plugin-lit
typescript-elizaos.description: A plugin that integrates Lit Protocol functionality into the elizaOS runtime environment, enabling secure and decentralized access control and cryptographic operations.
